snippet: A plan to reopen a mine in Spain has been stalled, angering local residents in need of jobs while leaving environmentalists worried that economic priorities will trump safety concerns.
abstract: Plan to reopen the Riotinto copper mine in southern Spain is stalled, tied up over regulatory delays, environmental concerns and a property dispute; reopening of the long-idle mine could provide several hundred jobs for the struggling town of Minas de Riotinto; problems with project illustrate the challenges Spain faces in digging itself out of a deep economic hole.
lead_paragraph: A plan to reopen a mine in Spain has been stalled, angering local residents in need of jobs while leaving environmentalists worried that economic priorities will trump safety concerns.

headline.seo: Red Tape and Disputes Delay Spanish Mine Project
headline.main: In Struggling Spanish Town, Hopes of Reopening Mine Are Delayed
headline.print_headline: Delays Mar Mine Project In Spain
